definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: Mummy brought me to a very big bookshop.
sentences.chinese: 今天，媽媽帶我去一間好大間的書局。

sentences.english: Was a typical modern spin vegetarian bookstore.
sentences.chinese: 點石齋是近代較爲典型的書局。

sentences.english: Parents can purchase textbooks from any booksellers.
sentences.chinese: 家長可自行選擇書局購買課本。

sentences.english: At no point did Penguin, the original publisher, withdraw the book.
sentences.chinese: 最初的出版商企鵝書局無條件撤回了圖書。

sentences.english: This is a significant characteristic of the Xiuzhou Bookstore.
sentences.chinese: 這可是秀州書局的又一大特色。

sentences.english: It keeps track of all the events here that are worth writing about.
sentences.chinese: 記錄的都是發生在書局裏一些值得寫的事情。

sentences.english: The Eslite Bookstore is to open a new flagship store for the Chinese New Year.
sentences.chinese: 誠品書局在農曆新年時將開設一家新的旗艦店。

sentences.english: He job-hopped to establish Zhonghua Book Company on the New Years Day of 1912.
sentences.chinese: 1912年元旦，他從商務“跳槽”而創辦中華書局。

sentences.english: We went to a bookstore and saw photographical books together.
sentences.chinese: 我們到了書局一起看了攝影的書籍。

sentences.english: Four Essential Classics is a big classical series of books published by China Publishing House.
sentences.chinese: 《四部備要》是中華書局出版的一部大型古籍叢書。

sentences.english: Introduction discusses the status quo study of Zhejiang official press and puts forward the significance of the topic.
sentences.chinese: 論述浙江官書局的研究現狀，並提出本文的選題意義。

sentences.english: This is Mr. Fan Xiaowo, Chief of the Xiuzhou Book Bureau.
sentences.chinese: 這位就是嘉興秀州書局的範笑我局長。

sentences.english: Elements of Discrete Mathematics, C. L. Liu.
sentences.chinese: 離散與組合數學，劉涵初著，華泰書局。

definition: books (in a library or bookstore)/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]
a series of books/a collection of books
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua
Taibei or Taipei, capital of Taiwan
Chinese national culture/studies of ancient Chinese civilization/the Imperial College (history)
to do textual research/to make textual criticism/to verify by means of research (esp. historical details)/to take an exam to get a certificate (abbr. for 考取證件|考取证件[kao3 qu3 zheng4 jian4])
Joint Publishing, bookstore chain and publisher, founded in Hong Kong in 1948
